Minor bug fix in DashboardControllerIntegTest.  Had to refactor DashboardController to not use singleton EventBusRegistry because the test constructs multiple instances of it, which never get garbage collected because the EventBusRegistry singleton has a reference to it.  Those non-garbage-collected instances continue to respond to events, causing random NullPointerExceptions

Using TransactionResult from VM APi project

- This change allows us to remove the old, overly complex structure
  relating to this concept which consisted of: ExecutionResult,
  TransactionResult (kernel side), AbstractExecutionResult, and
  IExecutionResult. These are now all gone and replaced by the new
  TransactionResult.
- All changes to source code are simple replacements of these old
  classes with the new class.
- All changes to test code preserve the test logic prior to this
  change and are only replacements and simple adjustments to new
  semantics, of which there are few.

Bloom now implements IBloomFilter

- Note that the BloomFilter class does not implement IBloomFilter.
  This is because the VM-related components do not interact with
  BloomFilter but rather with Bloom.

Using VM API Address and IExecutionLog

- The old kernel Address class is now AionAddress, and it implements
  the Address interface in the VM API.
- The kernel Log class now implements IExecutionLog.
- The bulk of these changes are all renamings to allow for this swapping.

AionTransaction now implements TransactionInterface

- All of the bulk changes here simply relate to using this new
  type and handling some of the side-effects that come with it.
  For example, different method names and the Address type that
  some of its methods return.
- Also making a method in AionTransaction synchronized again (but
  we should be looking into this ... it seems like improper
  synchronization).

AionInternalTx implements InternalTransactionInterface

- All changes here are simply related to this new interface type.

ExecutionContext implements TransactionContext

- All of the changes here are re-namings related to this change.
- One exception: the old ExecutionHelper is now a SideEffects implementation
  and its old 'merge' method no longer performs a conditional merge. We
  have separated the logic of this conditional merge out into two different
  methods to better suit an API and as such we have replaced each occurrence
  of that merge with this new logic, which is equivalent.

ExecutionContext implements TransactionContext

- The ExecutionContext class now implements the TransactionContext
  interface in the VM API.

Adapting to new ResultCode, TransactionResult

- These above mentioned classes are now interfaces and the kernel
  side provdes two FastVM implementations of them. All changes here
  simply relate to this new change.

Using KernelInterfaceForFastVM

- This is an implementation of KernelInterface for the fastvm.
- Most chanegs here relate to how we are now using this in the
  fastvm (namely in the Callback stack).

removed DataWord from interfaces in modAionBase

- updated aion_fastvm, modAionImpl, modPrecompiled, modAion,
  modApiServer, modVM, modMcf, aion_api with interface changes

Added Precompiled Result and Code

- The precompiled module will soon be detached from the fastvm and
  so it will also need to provide its own implementation of
  ResultCode and TransactionResult, that's what this commit introduces.
- Currently these classes are unused.
- Also note that they are copies of the fastvm logic. This is because
  the two shared a single path of execution on these points prior to
  this separation, and so this similarity needs be preserved.

modPrecompiled has its own ResultCode, TxResult

- All classes in modPrecompiled have changed to now deal with its
  specific ResultCode and TransactionResult implementation in order
  to move towards decoupling this module from the fastvm.
- Note that its implementation is identical to the fastvm
  implementation since the two used to share these classes.

Small dependency fixes

We are no longer using the libnsc jar directly, and some other
small fixes.

Moved some classes from modVM into fastVM

- The following classes were moved: TransactionExecutor,
  AbstractExecutor, FastVmResultCode and FastVmTransactionResult.
- This is a step on the way towards achieving the correct dependency
  relationship between modVM, modFastVM and modPrecompiled.

Removed ExecutorProvider class

- As well as its two subclasses - these all existed as a means of
  injecting the fastvm & precompiled depencies into modVM to get
  around the dependency inversion going on here. This is now done
  with.

Moved some classes from modVM to fastVM

- IPrecompiledContract is now PrecompiledContract and is now in
  modPrecompiled. IContractFactory is removed. ExecutionContext and
  SideEffects have been moved from modVM into the fvm.

BulkExecutor is now in place

- Though it is far from its final place. It is merely here so that
  the modVM, FastVM, modPrecompiled modules all have their dependencies
  solved.
- Now BulkExecutor in modVM sees FastVM instead of the other way round.
- The fastVM and modPrecompiled modules no longer depend on modVM.

Adding basic consensus test

- This test checks against only a very basic case, that none of the
  fundamental results required for network consensus are broken by
  any changes we are doing.

Added new class: BlockDetails

- This class anticipates the needs of the BulkExecutor once it
  eventually starts accepting transactions in bulk. In this case,
  the bulk transactions and their corresponding contexts and
  block will all be passed over using this single object.

TransactionExecutor now using KernelInterfaceForFastVM

- This will eventually be in terms of KernelInterface. But now
  at least all explicit reliance on IRepoCache is removed.

Some TransactionExecutor logic moved into BulkExecutor

- The BulkExecutor mainly takes care of everything the
  TransactionExecutor used to do in the finish() method. The
  TransactionExecutor now uses the KernelInterface to do its
  checks.

Removed VirtualMachine interface; fix to BulkExecutor; updated ConsensusTest

- The VirtualMachine interface is now removed. It will soon be replaced
  by the interface of the same name defined in the VM API.
- In the BulkExecutor, we are now using the repository more openly
  to help dis-ambiguate it with the KernelInterface, and also removed
  the failure rollback & updates that actually were already being done
  in the vm (rightly), making this redundant.
- Fastvm implements VirtualMachine
- The BulkExecutor now properly uses the FastVirtualMachine instead
  of side-cutting via the TransactionExecutor.
- The test is a bit more comprehensive now: it tests a block with 7 non-
  rejected transactions and 1 rejected transaction. One of these is a failed
  transaction. There is also a balance transfer transaction.
- The BulkExecutor no longer makes any assumptions about the number
  of transactions it is being sent (formerly it assumed always 1).
  Now it will handle an arbitrary amount of transactions and return
  the results.
- There is also some initial logic in place here to handle vm-
  delegation.
- The PostExecutionWork class now takes an extra parameter and the
  transaction type is now AionTransaction.

Added a method to flush a deep copy of a repository's state

- AionRepositoryCache now has a flushCopiesTo() method that allows for
  'sufficiently deep' (this term is defined in the method documentation)
  copies of the state of the repository to be flushed to its target.
- This method is essential for when a repository will flush to a parent
  that will create further children before the current repository will
  fully flush its changes all the way to the database.

VM API name change updates

- This commit updates the kernel so that it is using the same VM API logic
  as the AVM. The two are built off different vm_api commits, but this is
  only because the AVM commit has jar-building support for that repository.
- Otherwise, the production logic has not changed between the two.

  adds their shutdown to the shutdown hook.
- The VirtualMachineFactory has been replaced by a more flexible design with
  less reliance on static state.

Do not serialize transaction data if CREATE

- We were incorrectly serializing the transaction data if the
  transaction created a contract. We actually want to treat the
  data as an empty byte array in this case.

Fixed the RPC eth_syncing logic

- Previously we would report 'not syncing' when syncing and vice versa. This
  is now fixed.
- The API calls into eth_syncing now have documentation so we know what's going on
  and are more well-defined: they now handle the error cases of not knowing the local
  or network block numbers instead of giving these default values and pretending like
  nothing happened. This should also make it easier now for a client to determine
  whether or not they've connected to the network.
- The block numbers are now computed in one place only (not several, as before) so
  that the numbers are accurate.
- Added some unit tests to cover the testable part of the logic: the ApiAion::getSyncInfo
  method.

VirtualMachineProvider now only supports avm

- This class structure for maintaining the vm's is over-designed.
- The fvm is always constructed afresh each time it is invoked. The
  avm is long-lived. They have different life-cycling needs.
- This change also fits into our goal of splitting the boundary points
  between these vm's out more.

Create LongLivedAvm life-cycle manager

- The old overly-designed VirtualMachineProvider (and its related classes) have been
  removed and replaced by this simple LongLivedAvm (and AionVirtualMachine) classes.
- The AionVirtualMachine itself is thread-safe. The LongLivedAvm is the instance that
  everyone accesses over the lifetime of the kernel.
- Most of this change is updating tests, which startup and shutdown the long-lived avm.

PostExecutionWork now hides the top-level repository

- The top-level repository was only being passed into the BulkExecutor so that it
  could be input as a parameter to the work, which was very confusing because you
  had to keep the two repositories distinct.
- This change eliminates that confusion, so that the BulkExecutor only ever sees
  a single top-level (from its POV) repository, that it is allowed to touch.

BulkExecutor can be invoked explicitly without post-execution work

- The two constructors for the BulkExecutor were misleading, now the
  executor provides two unambiguous factory methods, one that accepts
  post-execution work and one that does not.
- The other constructor would not take a top-level repository because
  it only performed meaningless post-execution work.

BulkExecutor is now built via a Builder class

- The executor has a lot of parameters to be given, and many are booleans.
  This not only simplifies the building process but also allows these booleans
  to show up meaningfully (ie. not just 'true' but to have context).

Remove transaction contexts from ExecutionBatch

- With a previous change to eliminate the need of these transactions in the
  kernel-vm interaction, these are no longer used.

Created BulkExecutor factory methods to run entire block

- This is the first part in a change towards removing the unnecessary
  ExecutionBatch class. These two factory methods allow the caller to specify
  that all transactions in the block will be run, rather than only some.

Deleted ExecutionBatch class

- This class in not accomplishing much anymore (except for giving us an oddly-named class)
  since the transaction contexts have been removed.
- Trying to simply the executor and reduce the number of special classes needed to
  interact with it.

Separate Avm execution logic into its own class

- This commit moves all of the logic related to specifically dealing
  with avm transactions in the BulkExecutor out into its own class that
  the executor now simply invokes.

Separate Fvm execution logic into its own class

- This commit moves all of the logic related to specifically dealing
  with fvm transactions in the BulkExecutor out into its own class that
  the executor now simply invokes.

BulkExecutor is now stateless

- The executor now has two public static methods as the only way it
  can be interacted with. One of these methods runs a block of transactions
  and the other runs a single transaction.
- Removed the test TransactionExecutorTest::testExecutorFatal() because
  mocking static methods requires a different dependency and this test is
  actually only testing the correctness of Mockito (the mocked executor could
  be replaced with any class and this test would remain the same).
- AionBlockchainImpl and AionPendingStateImpl now have the RepositoryCache
  with the correct generics - encountered an odd compile-time error that
  was solved by correct usage of generics here.

Rename org.aion.types to org.aion.vm.api.types

- The package name org.aion.types will be used by a new aion_types repo
- This commit updates the vm-api and FVM pointers, and the AVM jars to use the new package name

Use AionAddress

- This is an immutable type representing Addresses that is used across the Aion projects
- This commit updates the pointers to the vm_api and fastvm with the corresponding changes
- This commit also updates the AVM jars for the corresponding change

FastVmTransactionResult no longer implements TransactionResult

- Additionally, the PrecompiledContract class no longer returns TransactionResult
  in the execute() method and now returns PrecompiledTransactionResult. This is
  both to remove the vm_api dependency here and also to make converting to the
  FastVmTransactionResult type easier.
PrecompiledTransactionResult no longer implements TransactionResult

Precompiled contracts have their own transaction context now

- The new class is called PrecompiledTransactionContext. This is mainly to
  circumvent dependency issues, since modPrecompiled should not depend on
  the fvm. Since we will be removing the common vm_api interface between them,
  the precompiled contracts now need a concrete class to talk about.

PrecompiledTransactionContext no longer uses TransactionSideEffects

- This is to remove the vm_api dependency. Rather than re-implementing
  side effects, the class now directly holds the logs, internal transactions,
  and deleted addresses.

Refactor BulkExecutor to prepare for precompiled contracts

- This refactoring it both to make the executeInternal() call more readable
  (by throwing the vm call logic into separate methods) since we will be
  introducing a precompiled option to this method soon, as well as to improve
  the readability/logic of determining which vm a transaction is for. This
  was done by explicitly pulling out methods that can determine which type of
  address the destination is, whereas before these types were being blended
  together cleverly but obscuring the idea. This will make the precompiled
  integration easier.
Fix PrecompiledTransactionResult bug
FastVirtualMachine now executes only a single transaction
BulkExecutor now delegates to precompiled contracts
Remove StatefulPrecompiledContract abstract class

Pulled contract address/owner into ContractInfo class

- Now there is one canonical location for contract address & contract
  owner address information.

isPrecompiledContract() moved into ContractInfo

- This method doesn't belong in a factory class, just separating it out.
Re #560: --redo-import now rewrites the index and prunes side chains

New implementation for ContractInformation:

- Refactored class to store multiple contract code varriants
  with corresponding VMs, inception blocks and completeness status.
- Unit tests added to ensure correct encoding when storing in the
  database and decoding upon retrieval.

Expanded StandaloneBlockchain to allow importing contract index information.

 - Updated MasteryConsensusTest for block 1023849 to include contract index in test setup.

AKI-183: Contract details vmType converted to local variable:

 - The ContractDetails snapshot now requires the vm type as parameter.
 - The Repository retrieves vmTypes based on contract and codeHash.
 - AionRepositoryImpl caches contract vm types while processing a block to allow transaction calls to
 contracts deployed inside the same block.
 - Updated AionContractDetailsTest encoding tests according to new specification.
Remove generics from validation rules and validators
Remove generics from Block and associated classes
Remove generics from AbstractBlock

Add methods to the interfaces Block and BlockHeader

- This is done to support getting rid of redundant interfaces, and the generics
- This commit adds more methods than we probably need. We should revisit and delete unnecessary methods later.
- The important part is that we do not move any PoW-specific functionality into these interfaces

Remove Block and BlockHeader generics from various interfaces and classes

- This is done to support the introduction of the new StakedBlock and StakedBlockHeader
- This change replaces generics BLK and BH with Block and BlockHeader
- This change also replaces most usages of AionBlock and A0BlockHeader with the interfaces, which is again necessary before introducing StakedBlocks
- This change renders IAionBlock obsolete, it is deleted in a subsequent commit
Shutdown hook with heap dump added as test-only CLI option

modPrecompiled now defines an IExternalStateForPrecompiled interface

- This interface is based off the KernelInterface, which is now no
  longer being used, but tailored for what the precompiled contracts
  require.

modPrecompiled defines its own data words

- The DataWord and DoubleDataWord are now defined inside modPrecompiled
  and the IWorldState interface requires that they be used in place of
  arbitrary byte array wrappers.

Remove KernelInterface from PrecompiledTransactionResult

- This commit also removes an unused alternative toString method.

Fvm now defines its own 'KernelInterface' named IExternalStateForFvm

- The IExternalStateForFvm interface is just copied from the
  KernelInterface but placed inside the fvm.

Move precompiled call into IExternalStateForFvm interface

- The fvm now calls precompiled contracts via IExternalStateForFvm
  rather than directly, so the kernel must provide this ability.
Fvm now defines its own data word
predefined error codes for exiting the application #856

Fvm moved some inner classes out of its Abi class

- This commit just updates how we reference those classes.

Fvm now uses aion_types Transaction

- A few tests had to be fixed because now the aion_types transaction will throw an
  exception if there is no transaction hash, and if a transaction is not signed it
  will have no transaction hash.

Fvm removed modBase dependency, some constants from Constants

- The fvm moved the constants related to it from Constants into its
  own FvmConstants class. Now Constants are related to transaction
  limits and fvm constants are in the fvm. The necessary modules that
  depended on these now missing constants have a dependency on the
  fvm in order to grab them.
Rpc: add hook to delegate particular methods to a new RPC framework
Incorporate initial version of auto-generated RPC framework
RpcGenerator.jar updated to AionRpc/c0cfe84
Rename RpcGenerator.jar to AionRpc.jar  updated to AionRpc/018a165
AionRpc.jar: update to AionRpc/6f5930d (ResponseSerializer validation and bug fix)
Removed lazy loading of AionTransaction
Moved encoding/decoding AionTransaction to utility class
Got rid of AionTransaction constructors without sender addresses
Renamed AionTransaction fields to match Aion-Types
Made all transactions signed in constructor
Made AionTransaction immutable
Added some tests for PendingState
Refactored config files to allow config changes from the cli

AionTxInfo clean up:
 - Removed AbstractTxInfo class and unused parentBlockHash functionality from AionTxInfo.
 - Moved the TransactionStore to modAionImpl since it was only used in this package.
 It can now see the AionTxInfo without the need for an abstract implementation.
 - Refactored blockchain interfaces to add the getTransactionInfo method only in the
 adequate package, moving its declaration from modMcf to modAionImpl.
TransactionStore and TxRecpt no longer require AbstractTxReceipt
Removed AbstractBlockSummary (redundant) and IPowListener (unused)
Removed IListenerBase (unused) and extracted its PendingTransactionState to a separate class
Removed AbstractTxReceipt moving useful functionality into AionTxReceipt
Added methods to execute options on devcli class and removed options from argument class
AKI-266: extending AionTxInfo with internal transactions
Extending RPC with internal transaction retrieval
AKI-24: Move modAion classes to modAionImpl

AKI-24: Remove A0BlockHeader from modApiServer

- This commit gets rid of the A0BlockHeader dependency in modApiServer,
  making it possible in the next commit to move this class into modAionImpl
  instead of modMcf, as well as the two related classes A0BlockHeaderVersion
  and BlockStructureException

AKI-24: Move remaining modAion classes, delete modAion

- These remaining classes have been moved into modAionImpl, or, where
  necessary, modMcf. The modAion module is also deleted in this commit.
New RPC layer: update AionRpc.jar to AionRpc/2fc5db3.  Add example impls demonstrating object (de)serialization.  Update RPC-related generated code.
RPC: Remove SomeStruct type.  Remove prototype RPC methods that were used only for testing AionRpc.jar.  Update AionRpc.jar to AionRpc/6036962

ObjectDataSource alternatives with caching and debugging features:

AKI-275: Cache contract index data + skip db access on empty code

FVM and Precompiled now returned wrapped transaction results
